summary: the ability of LAB to elicit an immune response against expressed foreign antigens has led to their use as mucosal vaccine vectors. LAB tend to elicit minimal immune responses against themselves, instead inducing high levels of systemic and mucosal antibodies against the expressed foreign antigen. the text of this review focuses on in vivo immune responses and on selected in vitro studies with a significant immune component.
